column4: Anybody have any ideas for what to do if the computer can get to the login screen just fine, but when a password is entered, the screen blanks for a second and then just goes back to the login screen?
your login session crashes for some reason
you can log in into a text console and read ~/.xsession-errors to get a clue
or you could press f10 and choose a different login session from the menu
I've tried KDE and Failsafe already. (It's Kubuntu that I've got.)
Any ideas for the next step?
/var/log/gdm/* would be where I look next
btw since you're using kubuntu, maybe it's /var/log/kdm.*?  I'm not familiar with kdm any more
Wait, gdm is the gnome login manager. kdm is what I'm using (it's Kubuntu). Either way, both that location and the same thing but with kdm instead of gdm don't seem to exist.
there must be log files somewhere!
Heh, yes, there must, but where I wonder? Aroo!
also, login session is a set of shell scripts; under /etc/gdm/, under /etc/X11/Xsession.d, under /etc/kdm (I presume)
you can always sprinkle those with echo 'reached point 47' >> /tmp/debug.log
